examples: heavy metal disks the size of hockey pucks
onion soup ladled over a disk of cheese

noun.description: A shape or surface that is round and flat in appearance.
examples: the smudged yellow disk of the moon

verb.description: Cultivate (a field) with a disk harrow.

origin: Mid 17th century (originally referring to the seemingly flat round form of the sun or moon): from French disque or Latin discus (see discus).
